text:
When calling the apachectl-script with invalid parameters, for instance: "$> 
apachectl gracefull" instead of "$> apachectl graceful", the server is killed. 
Perhaps the script should exit with an error-mesaage, without killing the 
server.
creator: info@orangexl.com
slive@apache.org
text:
I can't replicate this at all.  If you look at the apachectl script, 
you'll see that unknown options are simply passed through to httpd.
httpd in turn replies with its help screen to unknown options.

creator: info@orangexl.com
text:
Yes, I do get the help screen, but the httpd is still killed. But I guess it is 
not an Apachectl-issue.
